TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The Temporary "First Contract Edition" Thread

Articles.Content:
I chose a custom name for the update, "Kerbal Space Program: Money In My Rocket" (instead of "money in my pocket)

But I'm sure nobody but me thinks it's a good name.
64 bit windows.... YES YES YES YES YES YES YES YES YES.....

On Linux at least, steam users have both 32 and 64 bit versions available. Although Steam launches 32 bit by default, you can manually go into the folder and launch the 64 bit version (Steam is just the launcher, you don't need it to play at all). I expect Windows will be similar.

Felipe (HarvesteR): Ã¢â‚¬Å“But in a nutshell, yes, 0.24 is going to be released in 64-bit for Windows too.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Well done good sir!

Yeah I was expecting info on that this week as well. Though I hadn't even seen a link to a site. Happen to remember it?

We're due to talk about that separately from the devnotes. Last I checked it was on tap for this week, as I said last week, but I'll check again with Calisker to see what's up.

I thought the first hints we got about an official 64 bit build were because people found evidence for it on SteamDB?

EDIT: Found it!

I'd guess Steam users will be fine.

If you check that link then go to History OSX is listed as well if you hover over the top entry
Felipe deserves a hard-earned holiday
Is there any word yet on whether .24 will break saves for .23.5?

Is there any word yet on whether .24 will break saves for .23.5?

Sandbox should probably stay OK, career mode might not break, but you would have no cash to launch stuff.

Ã¢â‚¬Å“But in a nutshell, yes, 0.24 is going to be released in 64-bit for Windows too.Ã¢â‚¬Â

New sounds, new visuals, contracts and 64-bit?

Sounds too good to be true.

Oh, I voted for "Kerbal Space Program: Contractual Obligations"... because it's probably closest to the content of the update.

There is ABSOLUTELY no reason to assume you'll have to pay. It's as likely as them charging you again for 0.24

I'm so happy I was able to discover Kerbal on the last day you could buy the game and get all future DLC and such. I saw a 10 second video on youtube of someone trying to do a re-creation of the SpaceX grasshopper and I immediately bought the game. It was the best impulse buy of my life.
HarvesteR really deserves that vacation. I don't even want to know how much crunch-time overtime he did on his part to make contracts and 64-bit happen for 0.24.
There are many games that have x32 and x64 exe files, you just run the one you like. I don't get it why some people think they'll have to pay extra.

Kan't wait til kontracts komes out > * squeeeee *

Edited June 26, 2014 by Lohan2008

There are many games that have x32 and x64 exe files, you just run the one you like. I don't get it why some people think they'll have to pay extra.

Exactly, I suspect 64bit will be more stable than the hack but not stable enough to make it default. Keeping it as a separate exe should reduce the chance of people using it without knowing it might be unstable.

can't... con..tain excitem*POP!*

*edit. any chance we can get a sneak peek of what Hugo has been working on? PLEEEEAAAASSSSEEEEE?

Edited June 25, 2014 by Capt Snuggler

HarvesteR really deserves that vacation. I don't even want to know how much crunch-time overtime he did on his part to make contracts and 64-bit happen for 0.24.

I completely agree.

Roger, hope you get better soon

Thanks for the update Squad, looks like it's going to be worth the wait!
Yeah, no need for texture reduction ever again!

Yeah, no need for texture reduction ever again!

A variant of Parkinson's Law: Mods expand to fill available memory. I'm betting ATM will still have a place for those that must have ALL the parts and run up against their physical RAM limit.
Texture reduction will always be useful for players with low Vram. I myself ony have a 512MB GPU so ATM will not be going anywhere, for me at least.

ohh my gosh ohh my gosh ... x64 bit whooop ... never again will i have an out of memory problem runs around the room and jumps up and down whoop whoop

this update will be a real game changer money!!! ... we have a budget whoop it is now a game ...

i think this is the single biggest update you guys have made ... well done squad cant wait to play kerbal space program (the game!!)
Yeeeeha! New things, contracts and 64-bit!? That's the BEEEST Update ever! Now my 16GB RAM will make sense

Ã¢â‚¬Å“But in a nutshell, yes, 0.24 is going to be released in 64-bit for Windows too.Ã¢â‚¬Â

All I had to read to totally throw a legit fan girl scream. I won't lie didn't read the rest, this is all I needed to see to know .24 is gonna be EPIC!!!!
Regarding the "update name", I added my own: "Kerbal Space Program: Contracts"; simple is always the best approach IMO
